modes.name: Vulnerable Child
modes.copingStrategy: Fear, sadness, loneliness; seeks care but feels unsafe.

modes.name: Angry Child
modes.copingStrategy: Rage when needs are unmet; often disproportionate anger.

modes.name: Impulsive/Undisciplined Child
modes.copingStrategy: Acts on impulses; avoids frustration; difficulty delaying gratification.

modes.name: Happy Child
modes.copingStrategy: Joy, spontaneity, playfulness; unmet needs being satisfied.

modes.name: Detached Protector
modes.copingStrategy: Emotional numbing, withdrawal, shutting down to avoid pain.

modes.name: Detached Self-Soother
modes.copingStrategy: Escaping into work, substances, or distractions to avoid vulnerability.

modes.name: Compliant Surrender
modes.copingStrategy: Passive compliance; submits to others' control; suppresses own needs.

modes.name: Overcompensator
modes.copingStrategy: Acts opposite of schema: controlling, perfectionistic, competitive, arrogant.

modes.name: Bully/Attack Mode
modes.copingStrategy: Preemptively attacks others to avoid being hurt or shamed.

modes.name: Self-Aggrandizer
modes.copingStrategy: Seeks admiration; denies weakness; inflates self-image.

modes.name: Punitive Parent
modes.copingStrategy: Harsh inner critic; self-blame, guilt, shame, self-punishment.

modes.name: Demanding Parent
modes.copingStrategy: Feels pressure to achieve, be perfect; never good enough.

modes.name: Healthy Adult
modes.copingStrategy: Balances needs, nurtures Child modes, sets limits, realistic perspective.

metadata.description: Schema therapy modes with linked schemas and coping strategies
